## CES-D vs FNS

When conducting psychology research, especially in the fields of child development, nutrition, and mental health, comparing different questionnaires like CES-D (Center for Epidemiological Studies-Depression) and FNS (Food Neophobia Scale) can be crucial. Through the use of an innovative software tool called Harmony, the intricate process of harmonisation can be effectively simplified. Harmony deploys natural language processing and AI models to enable CES-D vs FNS analysis even in multiple languages. The CES-D scale is utilized to identify depressive symptoms, while the FNS evaluates a child's hesitance to try new foods. To determine possible relations or patterns, researchers would need to equate items within these two diverse scales. Normally, this would involve a time-consuming, manually intensive process of scoring and matching. However, with Harmony, the CES-D vs FNS comparison can be streamlined thanks to its in-depth language models that provide a percentage match between instrument items. By opting to use Harmony for CES-D vs FNS comparisons, researchers save valuable time and effort, allowing for a more in-depth focus on the outcome of the research. Using Harmony, traditionally challenging research tasks are simplified, resulting in more accurate and effective study outcomes. So, for those daunting CES-D vs FNS comparative studies, there's no need to fret - Harmony has got you covered.

## Compare the items in CES-D English and FNS

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import CES-D and FNS into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just CES-D into Harmony</a> - compare CES-D English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just FNS into Harmony</a> - compare FNS with other instruments
